Despite my apathy towards my dish, the waiter proceeded to convince that this was the "better" kind of noodle that is served fresh and has never been dried, and indicated that it was a fault on my part for ordering wrong (but this was just not my expectation when ordering a typical Vietnamese dish, and there were no pictures in the menu to indicate otherwise). The beef broth was also kind of bland despite being overwhelmed by an MSG-y taste that generally just left me parched and dehydrated for the rest of the day.  

I came here looking to satisfy my weekly pho craving, and I definitely left feeling like this didn't meet my expectations at all.  The flavorlessness of the soup base really reduced or washed out the flavor of the meat, and the wide noodles were just really soft and unimpressive.  The only pro was that it was a relatively large helping of noodles, so quantity-wise it would have been worth it if i enjoyed that type of noodle.  Unfortunately, with Pho 2000 conveniently next door, I wouldn't bother to give this a 2nd chance.
author: Kathy T.

description:
Excellent replacement for this Turtle Tower location.

Been here a couple times now and always eating happy. The pho is delish and appetizers pretty good too. I especially like their spring rolls.
author: Pauline T.

description: CRACKIN!! Love their wide noodles! This is the go to joint for pho!! The boss always hooks it up with the special hot sauce!
author: Jeffrey T.

description: Stumbled into this place hungover trying to head to Pho 2000 or something at 637. I thought what the hell, all I need is a bowl of soup. Ordered a small bowl of the usual steak pho. The order came out with flat noodles - I found it weird I didn't get the regular thin rice noodles. I asked them and they said they "don't have those". Really? I ate the soup but the broth needed a lot of seasoning to give it more flavor. I go to pay and they now want to tell me there is a $10 minimum with cards. Well there goes your tip.
author: Meghan F.

description: It used to be one of my fav and most often goto pho places honestly, great taste and great price. but after went there twice with the same serious stomachache, I seriously doubt the safety of the food here.. I have never comment any of the restaurant before, this is my first review. I hope they can take this seriously, get improved, and I will give it another try in the future...
author: Aly C.

description:
Best phó in the city. 5 spice chicken is stellar and the 3 color bean drink not to be missed.
Ask for the picked onions and chicle oil to add to your soup for some more heat.
Servers are always friendly and give you just enough attention to get what you need but enjoy your dinning experience.
 The restaurant is clean, which you wouldn't expect for its location that being said be safe walking there or maybe take a car if you are alone and not used to the streets!
author: Jay S.

description:
I love their Bun and Lemongrass Grilled pork rice roll! It is so addictive! I always order them whenever I go there. Have never tried their pho but according to my husband it's ok, the noodle is better than pho 2000 but soup tastes the same. 
The owner and waitstaff are super friendly too and their food is always consistent. It's a family owned business and the wife of the owner does most of the cooking. I always come here every time I'm nearby. This and then Saigon sandwich for dinner! Yummmm!
author: Sue L.

description:
Good food and clean.
The spring roll is awesome and pho noodle is not as salty at all.
The waiters are really nice and pleasant. I like to keep these mom and pop places opened.
author: Alison W.

description: Having tried about a dozen pho spots in the 'loin, I expected more of the same from Golden Lotus but I was wrong. The herbs are fresher and most importantly, they have the best version of the wide, flat noodles. Not many places offer this northern Vietnamese-style!
author: Elain S.

description: They make their own vegetable broth for the pho chay (vegan pho). Thai tea can be made without milk. Handful of other vegan dishes like bun.
author: W T.

description:
It's become a ritual every Sunday!

Turtle Tower moved down couple of doors to occupy a larger space, and what replaced them matches their quality with the southern flair. i.e, you get all the usual extras with your pho like basil and bean sprouts, while turtle tower is just bare pho.

Pho:
The broth is light and refreshing! The meat is tender and tasty! The basil, lime, bean sprouts, and jalapeños are fresh! The flat rice noodles are cooked to perfection, where they don't clump up! You don't need sriracha to enjoy this pho... It's soooo good!

Pho Ga:
They use chicken broth for the Chicken Pho, and it's just amazing as well!

Five Spiced Chicken Pho:
Pho Ga with five spice chicken instead

Vietnamese Iced Coffee:
Just get it!

Their rolls are good as well, but that's the same everywhere. These guys excel with their pho though.

Mmmm... thinking about it makes me wanna go get some pho right now. Which is exactly what I'm gonna do right now, since my first time trying out Spoonrocket has been a failure :/
author: Vijay A.

description: Good, clean, Vietnamese comfort food. Bún, pho, and spring rolls are all solid. Definitely not in the greatest neighborhood, but just make a beeline for the restaurant and you'll be fine.
author: Evan H.

description:
I like this place so much that I will go out of my way to eat here!

The food is always consistent and delicicous.  Service is always on point!
author: Avril C.

description:
This was a pleasant surprise - pho soups were flavorful and delicious.

Also liked how clean the place is - you can see into the kitchen from the dining area and it appears new and clean.

Will definitely be back.
author: Lev E.

description:
Omg. this place will completely surprise you given its unassuming location and the fact that it's located where turtle tower used to be.

I can't believe I'm saying this but I tried this place on a whim and it was amazing. The owner was very friendly. Their pho ga (chicken pho), spring rolls (we ended up ordering another plate), banh xeo, and the 3 color bean dessert drink were amazing! Every ingredient was very fresh and not your average pho joint. 

Super authentic and prices are great! Will be back whenever I'm in the area.
author: Farrah N.

description: Awesome, cheap Vietnamese food. Quiet place. I want to ask the waitress out on a date.
author: B H.

description:
I used to work in the Civic Center area and Golden Lotus was always in the running for lunch. It's also a post-happy hour go-to spot - clean, bright, tasty, and consistent. 

I normally order the five spice chicken with imperial rolls vermicelli bowl. The chicken is fragrant and juicy, while the imperial rolls are crispy with a nice light filling without being too greasy. I've also ordered this without noodles, so it's basically a chicken salad and it's still delicious.

As for the beef broth, Golden Lotus seems to have a naturally flavorful broth. All the times I've tried their broth, there were no obvious signs of heavy MSG. 

I choose this place over the other Vietnamese restaurants in the area because it's more affordable, more consistent, and a no frills restaurant that satisfies my hunger.
author: NickJess S.

description: Had the vegetarian tofu bun.  The tofu was really good. Plenty of veggies and a big bowl of noodles.  Food came out quickly and efficiently.  Service was good.  I heard their pho is tasty too.  A place to go for some yummy Vietnamese food.
author: Ang L.

description: The food is legit.  Try the spring rolls, imperial rolls, all of their phos are delicious.  Also try the garlic Bok Choy!
author: Dennis S.

description: A great Vietnamese restaurant that opens for dinner and accepts credit card. The broth for their phos is very delicious. We ordered the chicken pho and beef pho. I think their clients are geared toward Americans and Vietnamese, as there is no Chinese on their menus. It cost $1 more for a large bowl of pho. Ranges from $7 to $8 something per bowl.
author: Jennifer T.

description: A++ RESTAURANT. I come from out of town (Atlanta) and stumbled across this place. Great food, great customer service, and great Vietnamese atmosphere.  The "best seller" app is Banh Cuon Thit Nuong. Running the SF marathon so needed a carbo load. Had their rice dish w/potatoes and watercress salad. Pretty awesome. Definitely check it out!
author: Mister A.

description: Honestly.. I've been holding back to write a review... I wanted to keep this place to myself.. My Boyfriend and i have a Sunday routine wich usually consist of food mainly pho.. We were going to turtle tower and pho2000. One day both of the places we frequented happened to open up late and we seen that Golden Lotus was open, i mean what the heck, why not its just pho! NOT!! The flaovor profiles in each batch of pho are wonderful you dont need to water them down with a ton or siracha or hoisen sauce and the chicken taste different from the beef broth..not to mention the meat in any dish you get here is not DRY.. its super moist and edible!! the man at the front is so nice and we see him frequently that he usually lets us right in as soon as we get there!! It's not in the best of neighborhoods but i will say.. it makes it feel like home. :)
author: Jasmine M.

description:
On my way to a meeting on this laid back Sunday afternoon I  stopped in Golden Lotus for some great food! My friends and I have been here several times over the last month and the food is excellent.

Today I  decided to started off with the green mango shrimp salad. I was seated facing the doorway of the kitchen. As I ate my salad I watched the young man who 
was serving me repeatedly use his unwashed hands to arrange food on customers  plates. At one point he drained the water off a plate of steamed  sprouts by using his hand as the strainer.

Needless to say, I did not order anything else.

Wash your hands or get a kitchen door.

Disappointed.
author: Corey D.

description: Golden lotus is my new go-to Vietnamese restaurant. Great service, super authentic delicious Vietnamese food, and incredibly reasonable prices. Cheap, yummy and cheerful, and they even have the Warriors game on when it's game night! Definitely hit up Golden Lotus!
author: Tina T.

description:
It's turtle tower's old soul in it's old spot.  I've been ditching TT, Four Seasons, and Pho2K for this spot for a while.  It's a superb replacement.  Reliable quality and no wait.  It's also open late which is rare for typical Viets.

I would recommend their chicken entrails pho.  They load up on the entrails so you get entrails for 2 chickens in one bowl.  Sounds delicious?
author: Koalie W.

description:
Great chicken and garlic noodles.
Minus one star for using small egg rolls and calling them imperial rolls. Only Tu lan and cordon blue do this right.  Infinitely better than the turtle tower that it replaced.
I will reiterate that the 5 spice chicken is amazing.get it.
author: reza n.

description: The appetizer dish with the grilled pork wrapped in rice noodle is DELICIOUS. I don't think I could ever eat here without ordering that. It only comes with three rolls so the price is actually pretty steep for what it is. Pho here was pretty good and hit the spot but do note that they use the wider variety of pho rice noodles by default. They do have the thin ones upon request. During my last visit, I got the bun thit nuong cha gio. Their fish sauce is decent but I felt my bowl was missing some additional love. More fried shallots, green onions, and crushed peanuts would have brought the dish together more.
author: Maggi K.

description:
I mean love this place. Since moved to SF I've been coming back here at least twice a week ! This place is the only reason I come over such a messy area in tenderloin.
Next door is popular turtle tower restaurant, but I definitely recommend u this place better. Great and affordable foods n good service. Can't wait to stop by again !
author: Takami U.

description:
Turtle no longer.

Once was this: http://tenderlife.tumblr.com/post/52856383639/turtle-towers-former-space-on-larkin-at-the

Now is this: Generous medley of seafood rice plate (Com Xao Hai San Thap) for less than $10 and served as fast as a hare. Finished quite fast too.

Interior has a fresh coat of paint. Staff has a fresh coat of cheer.

No longer a turtle. But just might become as loved as one.
author: Jason B.

description: Five stars for the service, and my simple order of Vietnamese iced coffee served at a table. (Let's face it, a single beverage order would usually be to-go. It wasn't too busy, so here I happily sit letting the strong coffee and condensed milk do their thing.)
author: Caz C.

description: Best Vietnamese food in little Saigon. Quality pho that doesn't have all that oil seeping to the top. Their rice plates always deliver quality food and come with a variety of side dishes. If you're in the tenderloin craving Vietnamese food hit this spot up for sure!
author: Nick A.

description:
So happy I decided to come here! 
Went here after a long day at school before a volleyball game. Their pho has thin noodles and their meat is well prepared. Their vegetarian Spring rolls are delicious. I highly recommend. You can't find a lot of restaurants with good quality food. 
Not only that, their service are nice and food came fast! 
I def recommend coming and I'll be coming back.
author: Gillian Gail A.

description:
Stumbled upon this new spot (in the former Turtle Tower location) while sniffing around for a quick bit on my way home from work.

Smallish standard menu of apps, pho, bun and rice plates. Several of the dishes were misspelled so I wondered if it wasn't perhaps a Chinese or Thai run operation. Anyways, I was hungry so down I sat. 

Went with the Bun Thit Nuong Cha Gio (Vermicelli noodles with grilled pork and crispy spring rolls). This is an extremely popular southern vietnamese lunchtime staple found all over Sai Gon. I've eaten it countless times in Viet Nam and when done right- it's incredible. Many times it's just so-so. Kinda like Pad Thai or Chow Fun- a good barometer of the kitchen's competence.

Here at golden lotus they did everything right.

Meat: Properly charred & caramelized slices of grilled pork with just enough lemongrass fragrance.

Veggies- Good amount of shredded carrots, cucumber, lettuce, and bean sprouts in relation to the amount of Bun (noodles) provided.

Fried Spring roll- Crispy & well seasoned. Does it's job by adding texture and richness.

Fish sauce- Just sweet enough, although I would have liked to add some more chili to the concoction- and wasn't about to ruin my bowl with the provided table side Sriracha.

Portion size was ample without being Amuricun obnoxious large. A lot of times a big bowl of noodles will taste great until you're 2/3 of the way done. This was the perfect amount.

$6.65. Yup.
author: Anthony R.

description:
The old turtle tower location has been replaced by a new Vietnamese restaurant. Our curiosity got the best of us. 

We ordered to bowls of the dac biet pho. Interesting enough, they use the fat flat noodles you see in chow fun, pad see ew or with pho ga (chicken pho). It was the first time I had it or seen that type of combination. The soup broth was full of flavor and there were plenty of meat.   
 
Venue seemed clean and has tentative service. 
 
Personally, I like the regular thin noodles that are used for pho. Nonetheless, for those of you that like the thick flat noodles, this is the place for you!
author: Becky Q.

description: I was in this area after work to get something and decided to get dinner in this area. I was thinking of Turtle Tower but found they closed earlier than they did before. Therefore I have to place a try and ordered the chicken pho with giblets. It was okay, nothing bad but not outstanding either. The giblets portion did not stand out compared to other places I like going to.
author: H K.

description:
i love this place. it's pretty authentic and has dishes that are hard to find elsewhere.  

must try:  beef noodle roll

great deal and the servers were very nice.  

my only complaint is when they run out of banh cuon (the rice noodles), because that is pretty much the main reason i come here.  also they could put more meat on their Banh Uot!
author: Josie M.

description: I am a regular at Golden Lotus because they have the best pho ever and I always seem to be craving pho. I always get the number 22 and spring rolls. I like their pho way better than any other place I've had. The beef just tastes better to me and I love the wider noodles. The service is excellent- everyone who works there is so friendly. If you are a pho person you will love Golden Lotus.
author: Allie M.

description:
We go to vietnamese place all the time in tloin and when t tower moved down the street, this place sprung up like a lotus coming out of a crack in a crack neighborhood. turns out it's run by cantonese folk, so i immediately had my doubts since most of the cantonese run places in the sunset are so-so (or at least not authentic vietnamese). i'm canto mando btw. 

anyway, this place was surprisingly delicious. you can taste the freshness of the ingredients and they have slight improvements or at least takes on a bunch of the dishes. staff was friendly, place was clean, and my wife and i came away filled to the brim. would definitely come back. my top three in the area are now:

1) turtle tower for n. vietnam pho
2) ngoc mai for the bun bo hue
3) and this place for the typical pho with a twist
author: Stephen H.

description:
Well for a new business Golden Lotus was excellent. They won a regular customer. Great customer service, fair prices, delicious food so an overall great value. 

VERY clean establishment, which is one of the most important aspects of any restaurant. 

Friendly servers who a couple were obviously new but doing their best to accommodate to a new environment. 

GOOD food. Pho was reasonably priced for the portion given. Broth was tasty & hot. 

Actually takes credit cards/debit cards which is a plus since many places in the area don't. Big plus! 

Would highly recommend this new restaurant to anyone, good luck guys!
author: Josephine A.

description: This place is THE BOMB. It's so fresh. The noodles taste like they were just made, and the meat tastes like butter. They're one of the few pho places who take credit card so I don't have to worry about pulling money out at a sketch atm in the TL. Their customer service is great too, they make you feel at home, and they'll give you a big cup of tea. They serve their coconut juice in the actual shell. Check this place out!
author: Denise R.

description: Bun rieu tastes amazing and the broth is savory. My friends also love their bun bo hue. Service is awesome as well. Highly recommend this restaurant if you are looking for authentic and delicious Vietnamese cuisine!
author: Andy H.

description: This place is the best kept secret in downtown San Francisco. Great food, everything is good. Amazing service, the cooks, server and owner are all very pleasant and happy. Unbeatable price. Takeout or dine in. AMAZING.
author: Madie H.

description:
great service, quick service and the food was delicious!  The place is small and on the corner in a crappy area but the food was so good.  

The waitresses were very attentive and I would definitely come back next time I'm up in SF.

Prices were cheap too relatively for other food but higher than normal vietnamese hole in the walls.
author: Toby I.

description: Came in on New Years day needing a hangover fix and I happened to be in the tenderloin. I was hoping the food would be better since it seemed the area was populated with a lot of Vietnamese restaurants. I ordered a small bowl of beef broth with rare steak. None of the utensils on our table were stocked and the guy working didn't understand me when I asked him for utensils, so we had to walk around the restaurant looking for spoons and sauce dishes from other tables. That didn't matter so much because i was so hungry and all I cared about was getting my pho. The food came out quickly and I was so excited, until I tasted the broth. It was so bland. Not salty enough and the broth was thin and watery, missing the layer of fatty goodness of a good meaty broth. Everyone at my table ordered different dishes and the broths for all of them were consistently thin and bland :(
author: April J.

description: Omg turtle tower so over rated and screw the wait because right next door is Golden Lotus! Way better service and tastier too! My fave is the chicken giblets with thick/fat noodle and they put the yolk or egg in it too! Love it!!! Rather eat here then turtle tower anyday.
author: Theresa M.

description: Awesome place!  Very good food and very friendly service.  Love this place!  Will highly recommend this place for great pho and noodle dish!
author: Jay I.

description: perfect addition on Vietnamese food row -  golden lotus has more variety: pho, rice plates, other kinds of noodle soups like bun bo hue and bun rieu, dessert drinks, etc.  I especially like the vegetarian offerings - the veggie spring rolls has sautéed mushrooms and tofu in it, instead of spring rolls without shrimp and pork.   thanks!
author: Wakako U.

description: Meh pho!  I had the five spice chicken, bad slimey skin.  Five spice chicken should have crispy not slimey skin.
author: C L.

description: this place is hella close to my house. I get food from here all the time. super good, super cheap, super fast. all the dudes who work there know me now. I always get the vegetarian vermicelli with extra mushrooms and tofu or the vegetarian spring rolls. hella good.
author: Amanda C.

description: this place probably has the best pho in all of tl if not the city. golden lotus is the only place that i have found that serves their pho with fresh noodles instead of vermecelli. prices here are very reasonable as well. all and all this place has a very well rounded menu and you could basically get every kind of vietnamese dish out there.
author: Art N.

description: Great service, non greasy delicious pho and stew.  Their garlic noodles are the best!!!
author: Kim L.

description: Solid Vietnamese noodle restaurant. Reasonable prices. Not sure why but I feel lighter and cleaner after eating here than I do at other pho places in the neighborhood. I usually order bun thit nuong cha gio anywhere I go and Golden Lotus does a good job. Their imperial rolls are crispy and crunchy. I also like how the vegetables are sliced small enough to fit easily into one bite.
author: Brian E.

description: People were friendly.Food lacked flavor. Portion size was small - except for rice. Not going back
author: Frank S.

description: Upon walking in, we were greeted by a really welcoming staff! They were very kind about us just wanting a take out order and immediately took it and put it through. It wasn't super busy for the time we were there, but the order came out in less than 10 minutes which is impressive regardless. The food absolutely hit the spot!
author: Ashley G.

description: Golden lotus is definitely a solid spot for pho ga. Takes much cleaner and not as salty as turtle tower next door. Make sure you order their rice cake pork rolls.
author: James S.

description: It's more like 3.5 stars.  Cheap pho place with pretty big portions.
author: Matthew P.

description: About as good as it gets on the first try of a new SF pho place. Try the roll #2 Bo Lot wrapped in noodle-exceptional . #1 Pho was Hue style darker broth and very solid. Staff friendly;family business and great value . Also they were open at 6; Turtle (which moved a few stores up) closes at five.
author: Ken S.

description: Actually really liked this place - took over the original Turtle Tower location and serves up a great bowl of Pho - started with Calamari and it was nicely breaded, crisp and light with tender calamari inside.  Mixed beef pho was piping hot, very nice broth and excellent ingredients - a new up and comer in my quest for perfect Pho!!!
author: Richard D.

description: Good food, Friendly service, I am adding it to my personal list of quiet, well lighted eateries.  The atmosphere is quite good considering the neighborhood.
author: Sydney L.

description: Another new Vietnamese restaurant in Little Saigon.  All female run pretty much.  I was shocked to see an African American waitress at this very authentic Vietnamese restaurant.  The owners must be progressive as it is rare to see this.  Clean, warm service and great food. We've been twice already.
author: Laurence H.

description:
Very nice place ate the special pho.  Clean fresh meat.  Broth great with a hint of cinnamon. Flat rice noodles.  They way I like it.

Big time points for being CLEAN which is pretty rare sometimes in theTL.

Didn't try anything else but peeked around and it looks good also.

Good stuff all around.
author: Richard W.

description: Decent pho, gives a good amount of meat. They use the chicken pho noodles in their beef pho (I prefer the other noodles in my beef bowl).
author: James V.

description: One of the best beef I have ever eaten. The beef pho is a must try at Golden Lotus.  I live in San Jose and tried many Pho places but the quality of beef can never be compare with Golden Lotus quality.  The beef they used is so good that it's like butter that melts in your mouth.  The price was average like other pho place even though their quality of meats are way finer than other pho places.  The service i thought was better than other pho place.  Friendly smile and check up on water was on point.  Will definitely come back again.
author: Aaron W.

description: i must have ordered the worse item on the menu. ordered com tam dac biet and but there was nothing dac biet about the meal. the portion was way too small for a 12 dollar plate, especially the baby size eggroll and half a shrimp cake. food did not taste good at all, very plain, especially the pork chop. definitely wouldnt come back even if someone else is paying.
author: Ethyl M.

description: my first time here and i tried the rare steak and beef ball pho. it was really good! broth and meats had a nice hearty flavor to them. the rare steak was probably the softest (texture wise) i've ever had in pho before! will definitely be back if i am ever in the area.
author: Sabrina L.

description: Average. I ordered the combination Pho and the Bahn Xeo. The Pho was not what I expected it had thick rice noodles that I didn't particularly enjoy but the broth was OK. The Bahn Xeo had NO FLAVOR it didn't have that fragrant smell that I had expected and it was just tasteless as I had to add a lot of hot and sweet sauce.
author: N A.
